title: 4-year-old Gresham boy shoots himself in hand with gun
content:
UPDATE: Gun 4-year-old used to shoot himself was left unsecured in grandfather's room
A 4-year-old Gresham boy is recovering after accidentally discharging a gun and shooting himself in the hand on Saturday night.
The incident happened in the 1100 block of NW 15th Street about 8:20 p.m., Gresham police said.
Police said the bullet struck the boy's finger and he was taken to the hospital with non-life threatening injuries. It is unclear who owned the firearm or if the boy was at his parents' home when the gun went off.
"Detectives are investigating the incident and it is not known if any criminal charges will be filed," said Gresham Officer Ben Costigan.
Police said more information would be release as it becomes available.
